definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In modern poetry, there are sound and meaning with the structure of the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 在现代诗词中存在着音义同构的现象。

sentences.english: "Sudden leap" is not only the literal quaint, but both sound and meaning.
sentences.chinese: “趵突”不仅字面古雅，而且音义兼顾。

sentences.english: After careful screening we finally have selected a body of 463 vocabulary items showing parallels between Chinese and Thai.
sentences.chinese: 经过细心筛选，我们收录了463个汉泰音义近似词。

sentences.english: There're many regular patterns of phonetic and semantic correspondences between connatural Korean words and those in ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜语的一些固有词与汉语词有音义对应关系。

sentences.english: Li Ji's Jiuzhang Suanshu Yinyi (Phonetic Significance of the Nine-Chapter Arithmetic) has never been highly regarded, nor received any due attention.
sentences.chinese: 李籍《九章算术音义》一直未受到应有的重视。

sentences.english: The author attempts to address this issue by analyzing some examples of this phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 文章就此类音义错位现象选例作一些辨析。

definition: loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
phonetic component of a Chinese character
Qieyun, the first Chinese rime dictionary from 601 AD, containing 11,500 single-character entries
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
Jiyun, Chinese rime dictionary with 53,525 single-character entries, published in 11th century
